text: Bomber - it pours a heavy midnight brown with a thick brown fluffy head. An amazing layered aroma of roasted barley, piney bitter hops, sweet maple and bourbon barrel notes. All the flavor components are here in full expression- bitter hop notes, roasted grain, coffee, maple, woody bourbon and a hint of cocoa. Fabulous!

Bottle from a trade. Many thanks! Dark brown colour. Medium carbonation. Sweet nose of caramel, toffee, pine, citrus, tropical fruit, maple syrup, bourbon. Taste is sweet and bitter. I dont like Black IPAs but this is not a bad one.

Bottle sample- pours a very dark chocolate colour with slight beige head. Nose- piney, chocolate, bourbon. Taste- initially get that black ipa character but hops quite muted. then comes sweet vanilla, toasted oak, faint star anise. Moderate body with boozy finish. very complex and not too sweet given the maple syrup barrel aging treatment. I likely would enjoy this more fresh to get the interplay of the hops and the barrel but still tasty with some age on it.

Draft. Dark mahogany beer with a dark cream head. Pine and grapefruit aroma with light bourbon. Bourbon and grapefruit flavor with light pine. Medium bodied. Bourbon and grapefruit lingers with light toffee and light pine.
Bottle from Whole Foods NYC. Burbon really catches the nose. Vanilla, brown sugar, black strap molasses and spices. This is one of the better beers Ive had all year. Really nice and complex.

Bottle. Heavy toasted and molasses for the malt, moderate pine resin for the hops, light earth for the yeast, with maple syrup, cola and vanilla in the background. Head is small, frothy, light beige, with slippery lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is clear yet very dark brown. Flavor starts moderately to heavily sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes moderately sweet and lightly acidic and bitter. Palate is medium to full, oily, with a soft to lively carbonation and a lightly alcoholic finish. A great Black IPA that is rich, smooth and well rounded.

750 mL bottle from Beer Run, 4/23/16. Dark brown, thin foamy tan head, good retention. Aroma of roast, chocolate, maple, mild resiny hops. The taste is herbal and piney hops, chocolate, maple. Medium bodied, low carbonation, mild booze. Not really a Black IPA but it is solid. Nice beer.

Bottle into a snifter showing dark coffee with translucent coffee brown rims and half a finger of latte foam. 

The nose shows a lot of roasted malts balanced and brightened with a lot of vanilla bringing it close to a nicely creamed latte.

The palate is well carbonated and full bodied. Latte-like forward flavors with notes of maple syrup, vanilla, and a slight mint-like spiciness and a light hoppy bitterness on the finish. For such a big brewery with such wide distribution and great acclaim, Founders still makes a lot of solid beers.

Pours a very dark opaque brown with a thin off white head that rings the glass. Aroma is vanilla and dried dark fruit. Taste is dark roasted malt, butterscotch, licorice and sweet chewing tobacco. Very busy and very good.

Bottle. Pours dark brown/black with a thick tan head that left good lacing. Aroma of bourbon, maple, chocolate, vanilla and pine. Flavor was lightly sweet with maple syrup, bourbon, oak, chocolate, pine and vanilla. Creamy smooth texture, medium plus body, average carbonation. an awesome black ipa

Bottled. Probably pretty old. Pours black, almost murky ruby, tan head. Aroma is bourbon, maple syrup, fig, roasted malt, lots of booze, oak. Flavor is bourbon, sweet maple syrup, some coffee bitterness, roasted chocolate. Its probably old, I get no ipa character. Its just a bourbon barrel aged Stout with a bit of hop character? But barely. More coffee than hop presence. Fairly soft mouthfeel. Really nice. Its really good.

Bottle courtesy of a friend. Pours a deep obsidian with a tan head. Nose is roast, earth, huge pine, oak, bourbon, chewy sap, and more hops. Flavor is hoppy chocolate with oak, vanilla, bourbon, and pine sap. Finish lingers with bourbon and hops. Delightful - best twist on a black IPA I have seen.
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are sweet maple, roasted malts, vanilla, and some hops.
Black with thin Lacy beige head; aroma is hoppy spice/herbal; flava is complex blend sweet malt scotch bourbon wood hops; feels medium to light soft fizzy zing; finishes roasty tangy scotchy alcohol

The maple adds a sweet ending to the beer, not really able to put your finger on it that its actually maple, but great addition. Aroma is tobacco, chicory, cocoa, and a bit of sugary booze. Color is black with light head. Taste is not as boozy as expected. A dangerous high ABV that can easily be drank quickly as the mouth feel is perfect. Not sticky, not watery, just right. Bottle
On draught into a snifter. Pours black with a small brown head. Nose is bourbon and maple syrup. Taste follows. Very well made. Creamy mouth feel, but a fairly short finish. Tasty.

Draft at Zenos in State College for the Founders Day event. Poured a very dark brown color, with a small tan head. Aroma was alcohol, earthy hops, roasted malts. Light pine. Flavor was light roasted malt notes, earthy notes. Alcohol was hidden pretty well in this one. Tasty.

I dont even know where to start with this one. Simply genius. Great nose of maple and syrup and sugar. Poured dark black with slight tan head. Big front palate, little carb ... Pronounced malt and maple on front, transitioning to flavors of slightly bitter, oak, coffee, chocolate. The sweet and bitter keeps it rounded and being a black ipa and not a stout brings different, less heavy mouthfeel. Different than expected. Id love more, better than kbs, but not quite cbs. Second best beer in founders lineup... This needs to come back. If you like cbs, rhis is as close as it gets. Delicious, balanced, rounded, bug, sweet with bitter finiah, light in carb. Yum!

Bomber at campsite. This beer is huge in every way. So much going on its hard to distinguish flavors. Should be the perfect campire beer but the Atalanta and Lyric Ale were a much better pairing with the night. Slick, sweet, bourbon, super roasty, molasses and oak.  Too many hop notes to make sense of. I needed a 2 oz pour of this and would have been enough. 11% ABV and drinks like it. Pam gave me a little headache, really.
Bourbon. Totally bourbon. Lovely bourbon nose, chocolate, Brown sugar and awesome nose. Silly smooth and yummy. Chocolate, no hops and tasty as all get out.

Draft @ Kings Arms, Bethnal Green E2. Pours a black color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma with hints of caramel. Sweetish malty hoppy bitter caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty spicy hoppy bitter caramel finish.
On tap. Black with moderate head. Complex combination of hops. Nice bitter finish

750 ml bottle for a steep price of $17.99. (the sticker was still on the bottle but I dont remember where I purchased it) Pitch black in color, lasting tan head with lacing. Aroma is layers of pine, chocolate, wood and burnt maple syrup. Even after sitting it shows quite a bit of strong pine. 
Flavor also reflects the bold pine that states; I am a black IPA, deal with it. Also shows maple syrup, burnt sugar, roast malts, and oak. The strong pine fights the sweet, bold stout like qualities. Alcohol level is mostly hidden in a thick / full body. 
Overall is the beer interesting? Yes, it is. Does it have a lot of flavor? Yes, it does. Is this beer worth the price? Hell no. I guess for $18.00 I was expecting more.
Pours dark brown with manila head. Smell is bourbon, vanilla, oak, toffee. Taste is vanilla, oak, toffee, bourbon and roasted malt. Heavy body, light carb

Sampled on tap at the Knick. Neutral fruit, light alcohol vapor and a bit of oak. Dark brown-black clear with thin head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Sweet with some oak and balsamic woody sweetness. Alcohol and vanilla. Big warming after.
tap at 2016 michigan winter beer festival. Near black with small head. Malty and sweet with the maple notes. Strong hops. Light woodiness. Complex flavors.

Tulip at The Pump House. Light eating black with a one finger beige head. This is rich and substantial. A top shelf black IPA. Lots of earth, lots of black licorice, fruity hop notes, mild bitterness, roast, and lactic. Some wood, earth, and bourbon. Do I taste maple? Finish brings the alcohol. I am not a fan black licorice in this style but this beer is definitely a cut above.

Deep brown-amber with tan head. Sweet boozy aroma. Smooth and complex boozy flavor; moderately sweet then vanilla bourbon character followed by hopped ipa notes and a charred earthy malty finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Refrigerated 75 cl brown bottle poured. Black with beige head. Aroma is bourbon, medium/thick body, lower carbonation, and good lacing. Taste is dark malt, pine hops, and chocolate.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 Sweet and oaky nose. Dark black with medium dissipating tan head. Sweet with mild rye finish. Almost a stout with thick mouth feel. Just a hint of maple.  Boozy taste builds up the longer you drink.

Definitely get brown sugar maple in this dark ale with slight hue. Strong cocoa toasty light bourbon alcohol. Prune licorice taste with brown sugar maple. Hops kinda muddled but hoppy.Woody planty chocolate. Pretty nice.

Aroma: toasted malts, molasses, dark, ripe fruits, caramel, oak. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, small, really, off-white head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: caramel, molasses, maple syrup, chocolate, soft carbonation. Overall: nothing like your regular Black IPA, this is beautiful, lots of rich, dark and sweet malts in both aroma and palate. Pint at Kings Arms, Bethnal Green.

(Bouteille): Toute une surprise celle-là même si javais été seulement amusé par le service en fût. Léquilibre entre les houblons agrumes, sapin et lapport des sucres comme la mélasse, sirop dérable et chocolat est superbe. Belle onctuosité et adéquate sécheresse également.

Brown pour with a thing head, tan in color. Aroma of oak and oxidation. Full mouth. Taste is all over the place but it works. Sweet brown sugar, almost molasses. Some maple syrup and hint of hops. Thin mouth. Very interesting beer. Lace present.

My Bottom Line:
This unique strong ale delights with a maple syrup signature deepening the relation between roasted malts and coniferous hops.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A slice of foam sticks to the hazy deep brown.
-The sweetness has tons of personality, and it is perfectly balanced out by the chosen hops.
-I could easily see myself on a cool evening enjoying this near a campfire in the forest.
-This is a creative brew that showcases not only the brewers talent in the brewhouse, but also his sense of harmony.

Bottle.

Black pour with a frothy beige head. Aroma was a wonderful mix of piney hops, roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Wild stuff. Flavors were oaky with lots of pine like, dank hops, more vanilla, big roasty malts, touch of sweetened coffee. Viscous mouthfeel with moderate carbonation, slick and oily. Slightly bittersweet finish. This came across almost as a big black hoppy barleywine. Similar to that SN a few years ago. Maybe a forgotten style, the BLACK barleywine!

I really enjoyed this offering from the backstage series. Founders does bourbon barrel aging right and the maple syrup is a interest touch on this one; adds a nice touch of sweetness. The roast, bourbon, maple syrup and hops blend well together and create a smooth drinking brew. Thanks to kmbrewmaster in GR for hooking me up with this one.

750ml bottle.
Pours a deep, dark brown, almost completely black, with a brown head.
Hoppy, spicy, roasted aroma, spruce, wood, vanilla, coffee, grass, caramel, licorice, bourbon, and a weird green note that reminds me of green peppers or habanero.
Semi-sweet, hoppy, roasted taste. The hops are more subdued on the palate than in the aroma. Wood, caramel, coffee, licorice, cinnamon, syrup, ash, tannins, citrus.
Long, complex, balanced finish, surprisingly sweet, but extremely well made. (2016-03-12)

Blackish pour, moderate sized tan head, decent lace/retention. Aroma is maple, oak, chocolate, caramel, alcohol, light grapefruit and citrus. Medium bodied, fairly sweet - kind of its own style. I generally think that barrel aging IPA style beers is a fail, but this was kind of interesting - too bad it was $18 so Ill never have another.

Bomber from SHERM1016....thanks! Pours almost black with kinda foamy off tan head. Minimal lacing. Nose is dark chocolate; piney hops; bourbon; maple. Initial taste is above plus a boozy warmth. As often with BA stuff, improves as it warms. Excellent.

Keg at the Kings Arms - Bethnal Green, London. Great aroma, lots of rich roasted malts, burnt sugars, some line, raisins. Medium to heavy sweet flavor with hearty and gooey chocolate, some alcohol, oily pine, some ripe orange, licorice, burnt grass. Full bodied, oily and chewy, with fine to average carbonation. Warming finish, with more rich chocolate, ashy roast, scorched earth, oily pine, more raisins, light toffee, dark fruits, a bit of rindy citrus. Hearty stuff. Really enjoyable.
Keg at the kings arms. Pours deep brown, nose is toffee, caramel, maple syrup, taste is similar, roasted malts.

750ml bottle generously given to me by beerman6686 from his royal rumble free beer contest! Pours black with a thick foamy two fingers of tan head. Aroma of bourbon, sweet maple, earthy hops, chocolate malts, caramel, and vanilla. Taste mimics the nose. Was expecting it to be much sweeter from the aroma. Bourbon, dark malts, and earthy hops up front, followed by caramel and maple in the finish.

On tap @ Beer Revolution. Very dark brown colored beer with some tan foam. Much sweeter than I expected (didnt initially realize this was barrel aged). Lots of caramel, oak, vanilla, and toffee. Some roasted malts, grassy hops, and definitely maple syrup. Has a bit of a woody hop bite to it, too. Somewhat bitter in terms of the hop profile, but kind of overwhelmed by everything else. Some booze, chocolate, and lots of sweet sugar character like caramel and maple syrup. Bourbon, vanilla, and oak notes as well. Not my favorite, by any means.

Type: 750-ml bottle (25.4 oz.
Glass: Beer Nerd tulip
From: Whole Foods in Manhattan Beach, Calif.
Price: N/A
Purchased: Feb. 22, 2016; Received Feb. 23, 2016
Consumed: Feb. 25, 2016
Misc.: N/A

Had heard about this ever since Founders came to Southern California over the past few months, but had never seen it in stores or on tap. I knew of a few places that had the bottles, but they sold out quick. Luckily, my sister-in-law heard my wife talking about Founders and picked up the last two (hidden in the back) at Whole Foods in Manhattan Beach. I guess I never really saw what this actually was, but a black IPA aged in maple syrup bourbon barrels soundsinteresting?

Poured a dark brown, dark mahogany color with 3-to-4 fingers of khaki-tan, frothy head. Minimal wet spotty lacing. Below average retention. (Sight - 4.00)

Smelled a funky mix of hops and bourbon. Initially digging it. Can only point out Chinook but seem to be much more in there in terms of hops. Also got maple syrup, hints of molasses, licorice, oaky bourbon, caramel, toffee, slight booziness, butter pecan, creamy maple walnut ice cream, brown sugar and hazelnut. Interesting, but I like it. (Smell - 4.25)

Taste wasnt quite as good, but I got more definitive hops here. For hops I got Nugget, Dorado and Chinook. For the other stuff I got maple syrup, licorice, dark fruits - grape, plum and blackberries - molasses, toasted brown sugar, oaky bourbon, sugary caramel, sticky toffee, maple walnut ice cream and candied walnuts. (Taste - 3.75)

Medium body. Sticky texture. Lively carbonation. Long, boozy finish. (Feel - 4.00)

This was one of the most interesting beers Ive ever had. Still not sure if I liked it, loved it, properly rated it, overrated it or underrated it. (Taste - 4.00)

3.91 88 B+

Pours dark brown. Taste is bourbon, roasty malt, some dried fruit and the maple syrup is actually detectable. Alcohol is warming. Bitterness is piney and fairly strong. Really interesting and tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle pours thanks to Steve. pours out dark brown almost black topped with a tan head. nose is big roast malts pine and plenty sweetness. Taste is more of the roast malts a nice hop combo and plenty sweetness.

Enjoyed February 27, 2016 in a MadTree teku.

Look - Nice thick light tan head. Medium bubbled and settles to a light ring. Dark brown body. A lot of lacing. 

Smell - Maple. Chocolate. Soy sauce. Bourbon.

Taste - A lot of maple and chocolate. I cant tell this is a black IPA but it is a perfect balance.

Feel - Not too heavy at all. Well carbonated. So smooth. 

Overall - Black IPAs are good. Maple bourbon beers are good. I wasnt sure how they would be together, but oh man, great. I like this better than CBS. Not really for Black IPA fans.

The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: pours black with a beige head. Aroma is maple, malt, and some light hops. This is not a black ipa, but rather some sort of black ale. Taste is sweet and full of syrup. Hops are light and subdued. Maltiness is the main thing but not in a stout or porter way. Interesting. Not surprised it came from Founders.

Pour from bottle. Creamy lasting tan head. Rich maple notes, not crazy hoppy, but real good. Kind of sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Berkeley Bowl West. Pours dark brown with a clinging tan head and a citrus and treacle aroma. There is a complex full-bodied flavor that is includes dark molasses, maple and a magnificent finish that includes bourbon and, surpisingly, mint.

Capped 750 shared by Marcus. Pours brown with a slight tan head. Aroma to me is a slightly spicy maple. Med body at least. Flavor is maple, bourbon, mixed hop, some wood. Its sweet with some hop contrast. Gets a little earthy chocolate towards the end. Pretty nice stuff.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours black with beige head. Taste of maple an bourbon with some chocolate

Bottle. Glass. Nose is mostly roasted grains with grassy hop tones. Light booze character with some canola. Taste is moderately better. A bit crisp, light grassy notes with citrus. Modest dark chocolate. Ends with alcohol warming. Not the best black IPA. Not the worst. The barrel does help to make it more tolerable

Draft at When Pigs Fly, Kittery, ME. This is one incredibly complex beer. Its got enough hop presence to be an imperial Black IPA, but the bourbon barrel aging adds a lot of toffee, fruit, and booze. Very imaginative and pretty damn unique.
Pour was black brown. Chocolate colored head. Aroma of maple and bourbon. Flavor the same with vanilla and oak. Mouthfeel creamy and lightly carbonated.

Big bottle. Darkest brown in color with a lasting, lacy beige head. Flavor is complex, big on maple syrup, with oak, bourbon, roast, chocolate, toffee, and molasses. Big flavor, pretty sweet, malty as hell, with a bitter hoppy finish. Full bodied and slick, but with good carbonation. Solid offering.

Bottle pours a dark brown/black with a huge khaki head. Sweet aroma of chocolate, light maple, bourbon, some hop. Nice balance of bourbon and hops supported by sweet dark chocolate malts and maple rounded out by hop bitterness. Pretty nice!
Tap at Rattle and Hum West, New York. Colour is black with slightly brownish white head. Aromas and flavours: Some fruits, some sweetness, wood, some bourbon and roasted malts. Very good.

Dark opaque mahogany, ample tan head. Decent bit of vanilla, molasses and oak on the nose. Quite a lot of maple. Some darker pine resin hiding in the back. Pleasantly bitter, but quite a lot more sweet. Not unbalanced though. Medium body, very clean, kinda chewy. Long finish. Really good.

Bottle. Bourbon, chocolate-caramel malt, and grapefruit peel/pine aroma. Black with moderate tan head. Sweet maple syrup, chocolate malt, and moderately bitter grapefruit peel flavor. Nice body. Pretty sweet but not overly so.

28/I/16 - 75cl bottle @ ElMananas place - BB: n/a (2016-83) Thanks to Steve for sharing the bottle!
Clear dark brown to black beer, small irregular beige head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: very distinct, floral and fruity notes, but different... MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: lots of bourbon, sweet touch, caramel, pretty bitter, fruity, some citrus. Aftertaste: bit sweet, very fruity hops, citrus, tropical fruits, little sourish, some caramel, vanilla touch, lovely combo imho! Really enjoyed this one!
Bottle. Deep black color. Sweet boozy taste. Not very hoppy. Almost like a imperial stout or strong Belgian

avoided for obvious reasons, but it pretty much fell in line .. . dark brown, mild foam, good lacing .. . tar, roast, burnt grass, no barrel, no maple, off mild sweetness .. . empty and expensive, not a good beer .. . . Whos the scariest person in an office? The BOOkkeeper Hi, Im Zack. If you tell jokes like this, you might have the Dad virus. Get checked
VERY busy beer and not in a good way, specifically in flavor. Just cant get a real take on this. Very confusing experience with too much going on, hard for me too appreciate.

Sampled from bottle @ "Het is allemaal de schuld van Koen" tasting. Opaque very dark brown color, average sized off-white head. Smell and taste malts, slightly hops, some alcohol, harsh roast somehow. Medium body, fizzy carbonation. Hmm disappointing really, certainly as a Black IPA. Meh.

Dark brown pour with a small light beige head. Aroma of hops, roasted malts, wheat and maple. Taste of roasted malts, hops, wheat, slight oak and a subtle hint of maple. Full bodied, medium carbonation, hoppy finish. Everything just not coming together for me on this one.
Weird one. Doesnt suck at all and is one of the better special releases they have had of late. Maple syrup is still pretty subtle but works with the lingering hop bitterness.

On tap at Petes Brass Rail. It pours a dark brown color with a light tan head. The aroma is caramel and maple forward with a hint of cocoa and some peachy/fruity hops. Sweet smelling. The flavor is toasted with fruity plum and peach notes. Hints of pine and maple syrup. Very thick and sweet. A little roast and subtly piney in the finish. The sweetness is the thing here. Ok.
Bottle at home, brought by Steve, thanks! Vanilla, bourbon, light bitterness, Very nice balance between the hops and the exotic fruits of the hops, with the sweetness and vanilla of the bourbon.

[From notes] 750ml bottle. Black color. Thin bubbly off-white head. Some bits, short ropes of lace. Great bigger earthy hop, mild pine, touch of citrus. Lovely barrel character -- maple syrup comes through awesomely, mild touch of bourbon vanilla. Makes for a slightly richer, cake-like chocolatey malt character. Surprisingly nice balance to this, not as crazy weird as most BA IPA. This actually works. Maybe because its not as bitter as most, nor as hoppy. Has a lot of good malt character, nice chocolate, its kinda stout-like. Moderate-plus sweet taste, lighter bitter. Hardly any alcohol, hides it really well actually. Medium to bigger body. Smooth, lighter carbonation. Kind of creamy texture, mildly chewy. Light slick. Pretty awesome, satisfying, tasty stuff. Very unique and interesting. Much smoother and less harsh (with the barrel) than I expected. Nice.

Black color. Nice , beige head. Pine , chocolate , roasted malt , tropical fruits , hint of wood in aroma . Rich , bittersweet taste with mild ,bourbon notes . This is somewhere between IPA and imperial stouts .
Draught at Harrys Hofbrau. Clear cola and white head. Full floral and perfume hops. Taste is pine, flora and maple/bourbon.

Draft at Capones. Hazy black pour with tan head. Nose was dark malt, hops, cacao, maple, bourbon. Tasted very complex, with notes of maple, malt, bourbon, oak, hops, cacao, and a rich finish. A wonderful beer.

A delicious beer that really feels far closer to an imperial stout than an IPA, especially in appearance. The flavor of this has some chocolate to me, with a little sweetness. Quite pricey but actually worth it.

12/26/15. Bottle thanks to my parents. This is a strange one. Brown pour with a small tan head. Weird aroma - mix of hops, bourbon, maple, pine, coffee... its not awful, just definitely weird. Why do they insist on aging everything in these weird maple barrels? Anyway. Tastes about like that as well. Bitter, some hoppiness, citrus, pine, but also maple bourbon, coffee, chocolate, sweetness. Again, not bad, just a little weird. Not really my thing. I feel like people would either love or hate this. Im sort of just meh.
750-ml bottle from binnys Hyde Park. coffee nose, roasty, vanilla roundness, creamy, bitter finish. so dark and roasty you could call it a hoppy (ba) (imperial) stout.

Delicious beer. The maple bourbon flavor probably wouldve fit better with a barley wine but still a delicious and decadent beer. Aroma was oak, vanilla and bourbon. Pour was a nice deep dark brown/near black with a thin light tan film for a head. Taste was big and full. Heavy caramel, vanilla and bourbon flavors that filled the whole mouth. The hops came out in the finish- the sweet flavors kind of clashed with the bitterness left behind. Good carbonation
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Pours dark with a thick foam head. The aroma is of oak, very earthy, bourbon, noticeable maple notes. Tasting is of roasted malts, defined wheat flavor, mild bourbon, herbal, and a clean bitterness. The maple comes through nicely. Almost too much maple but the bitterness and bourbon put it into check. The body is well done, not too heavy just right. The finish is good and leaves a pleasant hop bitterness. Overall I enjoyed this but it might strike some as surprisingly too sweet for a dark ipa style.
Bottle @ joes goes whale hunting. Black colour with a medium sized beige head. Smells thyme, mint, herbs. Tastes herbs, mint, thyme. Too herbal. Medium body, nice carbo.

Sample from HO1K. Pours a deep cocoa brown with a thin white ring. Aroma is oaky, earthy, and some sweet bourbon. Taste is fairly smooth. The alcohol isnt too harsh or overwhelming but is actually too sweet for my liking. Not what I expected from what I have heard about this. Somewhat disappointing mostly for too much sweetness.
Delicious. Black with foamy head. Draft pour at bad apple. Malty and cocoa. Some fruit notes. Good shit

draft sampler that was served way to cold...so it took awhile to drink this one to find the flavors. at first I was put off by it. the only thing I got in the nose was booze. it poured almost black slight head...and just a boozy and oaky nose. but the warmer it got the better it tasted...not only the booze and the oak but finally get to the hops. this beer is probably really good at room temp. roasted malts plenty of hops and oak...yep thats about it.

Really good black. The bourbon comes out front and center along with a burn and warmth. With that hits a slight sweetness fades on the palate, leaving a seasonal burn in the whole mouth. This is a really good ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Homer! Pours clear mahogany black, large puffy tan head, dissipates fairly slowly, lots of residual and lacing. Aroma is odd, maple syrup definitely, some pine, cocoa, roast malts, oak tannins. Flavor is more maple, vanilla, cocoa, oak, pine. Medium sweet, light plus bitter, some lingering black tea like notes. Medium body. Weird one and it doesnt really come together for me. All of those hops are just wasted in this effort.
Tap @ the Answer. Very dark with thin tan head. Smells very sweet like molasses with an astringent streak behind it. Flavor is also super.sweet with a weird almost anisey middle then dry .

This is a warming, smooth, BIPA, not heavy or maltish. Nice finish with hints of maple. This is the first barrel aged ale I've had that appears to be done the right way. Bit of chocolate with a hint of nut as well. Yes, mmhmmm. I see. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750 ml bottle poured into a snifter. The beer is a dark brown to black with a khaki head of foam. The aroma has strong bourbon notes with a touch of pine character to it as well. The taste has some earthy, piny bitterness to it, but the bourbon and roasty notes are really what made this beer. All things considered, the beer is good. However, it is fairly odd, and very different from any other Black IPA I have had previously.
750 ml bottle. Pours pitch black with a medium beige head. Aroma of maple syrup, dark malt, bourbon, oak and pine. Taste of dark malts, oak, bourbon, maple syrup, pine and hops.

Black IPA or hoppy stout - after time in maple bourbon barrels theres not much difference. Not as much maple character as Idhoped, just a subtle sweetness in addition to the hops and dark malt and bourbon and molasses. Great body and easy drimking for a big beer. Really good, if not quite elite.
This is one of best beers Ive had in a while. The hops are plentiful and varied but so balanced and counter pointed by the dark malt, oak, and maple. Its not too sweet but complex and awesome
Black like oil.. Little head. Flavors of licorice, sweet malt and bitter balancing hops. Hides its strength. well. Comp;letely delicious.

At first I was giving this but I really high score thinking this was an imperial stout but then the double checked, oops. Wouldve made a great one. Cant taste any hops. The maple is freakin dialed in.
The stock deScription hits it spot on. Though the hop profile was more background for me. The beer is rich and powerful. A great one for sharing as a whole bottle would be too much in one sitting.

Keg @ Republic 7 Corners. Black pour with a substantial thick tan head. Nose is fairly sweet. Distinct maple syrup and nutty malt. Chocolate and burnt brown sugar. Mild pine. Flavor is initially fairly bitter. Peppery hop, mildly spicy. Mexican hot chocolate. Mild vanilla. Ends with a very sweet maple accent. Full body, fat and substantial.
Bottle in LA. Bourbon barrel, big hops, roastiness. Barrel aged imperial black IPA - a first! Very nice.
Black color, tan head. Creamy and hoppy, lightly sweet, ashy, roasty, chocolate, oak and maple nuances.

(bottle - 750 ml) Dark black pour with a creamy tan head. Very light aroma. No hops. Mostly maple and bourbon. Flavor starts off with a light hint of hops, then they disappear instantly and leave a bourbon sweetness and literally no aftertaste.
This isnt really much of an IPA, more like a hoppy black barleywine or something, because the maple is really intense and its sweet as hell.

This one of the more Stout-like Black IPAs Ive had, and this one of the few times you wont catch me bitching about it. So much of this blackened brew reflects the mastery shown in the best Founders Stouts. A mature yet smooth quality from barrel-aging. Oak, warm booze, roasted malt, and mellow maple syrup. And yet, theres this piney, herbal note coming from the blend of six hops. Compared to the brewerys equally awesome Dark Penance, Project Pam is something more refined and complex. This is a Black Ale full of surprises.

Backlog from a recent bottle share, 750 ml from a friend. Black appearance with a lingering khaki colored head. Dark malty aroma with notes of pine, earth, caramel, toffee and light maple syrup. Similar flavor, adding moderate bitterness and mild sweetness over a medium to full body. Pretty good overall.

A bomber pour. Nearly completely black in color. A thin tan head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is a sweet bourbon with dark fruits. Sips fill the mouth with flavors that linger on the tongue and at the back of the throat. Flavors include (in no particular order): oak, bourbon, maple syrup, vanilla, toffee, cocoa, toasted coconut, raisins, dates, molasses. Since not a barrel-aged stout, the mouthfeel is not chewy, therefore easily quaffable. This black IPA is expertly balanced between sweet and bitter. The lingering prickly flavors from the six-hop flavor profile perfectly counter the forefront sweetness. Founders is an impressive brewery. Their flagship line of 12-ouncers are all good, complex brews, but their bomber line notches up the quality even more.

Bottle.

A- Whiskey, maple syrup.

A- Dark brown color, dark liquid, beige head.

T- Whiskey, maple, oak, subtle bitterness.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- Very tasty! Loads of maple but not too sweet, Plenty of whiskey but not boozy. The bitterness is pretty soft. Overall, this is just balanced and delicious!

Aromas of massive hops, lemon, lemon drops, banana, grapefruit, herbs, resin, dark malt, chocolate and toffee. Pours a blackish brown with a thick white foam and lace. Taste is massively bitter hops, pines, herbs, resin, hop oils and buttery hops dominate upfront. Mid palate brings strong notes of honey, maple syrup, sticky malts, molasses, sticky caramel and subtle bourbon qualities. Finishes sticky with notes of honey, caramel and wort malt. Residual hop resin and oils are also present on the finishes. Noticeably boozy finish. Overall, really outstanding take on a black IPA. Among the best. Incredible hop profile, yet the darker malts and maple syrup brings more complexity. Bourbon is more subtle, yet noticeable.

Pours a key black color with no head retention and minimal lacing. Smells heavily of caramel and bourbon. Tastes like vanilla and bourbon and leaves a sweet warmth in your chest after drinking it. A really nice drink!
Pours black with a very little beige head and no lacing. Aroma of chocolate and alcohol. Tastes of chocolate and etoh. This is nice winter beer.

On Draft at Pony Bar HK. Pours a deep brown body with thin lace. Sweet chocolate syrup and sugar on the nose. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with notes of bourbon, brown sugar, malt, caramel candy. Christ, so sweet.

750 thanks to jsquire. What a interesting beer, very hard to pin down. Pours a dark brown color with a medium brown head. A big boozy nose, chocolate, bourbon, citrus. The beer is not much of a BIPA really, it has that but the vanilla, prunes and bourbon are much bigger. Sweet throughout with sticky sweet hot bourbon. Not that this is bad, it just isnt a big hoppy CDA. I suspect this ages well and moves even more toward a dark ASA or BW. Very drinkable. Soft palate. Id love to try this fresh on tap.

Deep aromas of bourbon. Thick, syrupy body full maple and subtle black fruit that evolves into powdery chocolate and fudge notes, lingering with spicy pine cone hops. Shows a vinous texture and lingers with bourbon and vanilla bean notes.

Bottle shared by Rogueone. The beer pours opaque black with a medium thick foamy tan head that diminishes gradually. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of bourbon, malt, chocolate and hops. Full-bodied with flavors of oaky vanilla, maple, bourbon, malt and citrusy hops. The finish is boozy with a chocolate malt and hops aftertaste. Should be a mess but holds together well and is an enjoyable beer overall.
750 ml bottle. Big nose: citrus, chocolate, vanilla. Pitch black with a nice, lacy head. Very hoppy flavor, lots of chocolate, good citrus, light vanilla. Nice.

Draft at Khyber Pass. Very dark clear russet brown/black pour with a frothy tan ring. Lasting wet lace. Glossy sweet dark malts. Complex palate. Dark chocolate cherry cordials. Molasses candies. Black liquorice. Dried blueberries. Charcoal briquettes. Burnt pecans. Cigars. Port. Turkish coffee. Vinyl jacket. Shoe polish. Maple syrup. Sweet tea brandy. Purple passionfruit. Tons of delicious syrupy flavors though not much aroma (probably because it was too cold.) Less robust than other big Founders brews but solidly refined. ABV well hidden. Worth seeking out!

Dark brown/black color; Medium slightly creamy body; Aroma of toasted sweet malt, maple, vanilla, coconut, and bourbon; Flavor of sweet roasted malt, caramel, maple, pine hops, fruit/citrus, and bourbon notes; Finish is fairly bitter; Very interesting & good!

750 ml bottle into snifter, bottled in 11/2015. Pours nearly opaque dark brown/black color with a 1-2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Light spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, light pine, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, maple, toffee, vanilla, toasted oak, coconut, bourbon, light smoke, and roast/oak earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of citrus/tropical hops, dark/roasted malt, and maple bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, lemon zest, orange peel, light pine, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, maple, toffee, vanilla, toasted oak, bourbon, coconut, light smoke, and roast/oak earthiness. Light-moderate pine/roast bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of citrus/tropical hops, chocolate, cocoa, caramel, maple, toffee, vanilla, toasted oak, bourbon, coconut, and oak/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, dark/roasted malt, and maple bourbon barrel flavors; with a great bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium-full body; with a very smooth, creamy/silky, and slightly sticky/chalky mouthfeel that is awesome. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warmth lingering after the finish. Overall this is a fantastic barrel aged Black IPA style. All around outstanding complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, dark/roasted malt, and maple bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Aroma caramel, grass, alcohol, woody, 
Appearance brown, black, tan foam, 
Taste heavy sweetness, lightly bitter, 
Palate medium body, long finish, 
Overall a very sweet beer. I could not finish a whole bottle by myself. Not the type of beer for me. Tasted like nothing I have ever had before. I would not suggest this beer to a friend.
750ml->snifter. Black with moderate tan head. A: booze, roasted malt, spice, oak. T: spicy hops, sweet malt, booze. Smooth palate. Really good.
UPDATED: JAN 10, 2016 This was special. Great balance of malts and hops to deliver a great black IPA. The maple syrup takes this to a whole new level. Outstanding brew.

Shared 750 ml. bottle poured to snifters, displaying a ruby highlighted, dark brown color, with a presentable layer of tan head foam, and spots & strands of lacing. The nose was mocha notes, but not a heavily roasted nature, caramel, toffee, and some syrupy sweetness, with a slight vegetal hint. The taste presented somewhat similar notes, included earthy, resinous, and slightly tannic bitterness, and some bourbony warmth, in a medium body, all conveyed by fair carbonation. A decent enough Black IPA.
Draft at Mahoney's. Pours black with lots of light tan head and lacing. Nose is maple, roast, coffee. Taste is similar with some bitterness in the aftertaste. Good.

I thought this was a pretty wild beer. Tons of chocolate and dark malts. Im not sure what style I would consider it. It was a little heavy on the malts for me to say it was a definitive IPA; however, it didnt have a super thick or syrupy feel. Lots of flavor throughout. Pretty cool, a little crazy.
On tap at Capones. Poured a black color with a small sized off white head. Wood, maple syrup, chocolate, vanilla, and caramel.

Aroma of piney chocolate, maple and bourbon. Opaque black with tan head. Taste is maple, vanilla, bourbon, bitter pine and citrus. Has the bitterness of a black IPA with the sweetness finish of chocolate, maple and bourbon. Very nice.

Draft. Medium tan head atop dark brown body. Aroma is moderately sweet, chocolate icing, some Bourbon, light vinous, earthy. Taste is moderately sweet, milk chocolate, chocolate icing, some vanilla bean, light alcohol warming. Sticky medium-full body.

750 ml bottle from Schnucks on the Hill, picked up over Thanksgiving weekend in St. Louis. Used to be my go-to Schnucks and its much better than the ghetto-ass Kroger I go to now. Anyway, this pours a deep, opaque brown with a centimeter or so of beige head, soft in texture, that laces the glass while settling into a lasting film and ring. The initial aroma favors the black IPA base more - dark chocolate, earthy and citrusy hops, and some mellow roasted malts - but over time, it opens up and the barrel leads the way, with notes of vanilla, caramel, maple syrup, marshmallow, and oak. Flavor of dark chocolate, maple syrup, orange zest, oak, marshmallow, toasted brown sugar, fudge, vanilla, and some bitter earthiness on the back end. Medium-plus bodied, with modest carbonation and a sweet, smooth, bitter mouthfeel. This is really good. I wasnt sure what to think about a barrel-aged black IPA but this is big-bodied and balanced enough to make it work. Dont know why I ever doubted Founders.

Bottle from Meditrina. Black with lasting head and lace. Wicked boozy vanilla chocolate woody aroma with some woody and citrus hops and a hint of cinnamon. Very sweet chocolate maple syrup boozy thick boozy vanilla chocolate with wheat tang that enhances the booziness with boozy finish that overwhelms the hops. Boozy. Probably the fullest bodied beer Ive had since I dont know when. Drink it with a spoon. Take my advice -- share a bottle with 25 friends. Gross.
Pours deep mahogany into a tulip. White head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Bourbon aromas. Hot dark chocolate and oak front to back. Hot bourbon burn finish.

Bomber. Deep, nearly opaque, chestnut brown pour with a frothy mocha colored head, excellent retention. Nose is cocoa, barrel booziness, dried fruit, vanilla and hints of citrus peaking through from the hops, reminiscent of chocolate covered orange peel. Mouth is medium bodied, slick and relatively sweet, vanilla, maple, figs, coffee, pleasant underpinning bitterness of an IPA but with more of a porter-esque mash bill. Finishes warm and boozy, great tipple for a raw, wet and windy Chicago evening in late December. I definitely need to grab another bottle of this before it disappears. Seasons greetings!
Bottle from Binnys Southloop. Poured almost black with beige head. Aroma sweet maple vanilla barrel char pine. Bitter pine resin taste. Bleh

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours dark brown with a decent size khaki head. Aroma heavy oak, vanilla, cocoa, and maple. Taste is pleasantly sweet but not overpowering. The oak notes really shine along with the cocoa, with maple on the back end. Solid beer, but still very boozy.

Pours thick dark blackish unclear with a big creamy head. Aroma brings big oak and toffee, boozy toffee. Flavor is so delicious bringing sweetness from the maple combined pleasantly with the barrels, woody flavors with some oats and vanilla. The body is creamy and delicious.

Black pour with a creamy beige head and lots of sticky lacing .... Aroma of maple bourbon and sweet roasted/citrus notes .. Taste is of sweet maple and bourbon with some light dry oak and a sweet malt with light citrus notes and some caramel and aged citrusy hops (even though they are fresh) roasted malt notes as well .... Kind of like they dunked an IPA in a barrel of CBS
Recent bottle, an American black, hops balanced with the bourbon and maple taste. Sweet edge, bourbon most outstanding.Above average mouthfeel.

On draft at Fraser's Pub. The pour is a near black with a bit of garnet shining though. There isn't thicker cream colored head and a bit of lace as it falls. The aroma is different, that's for sure. There is a little maple sweetness up front before a rather resounding bitterness comes in. The malts are a little reserved until the back end. There is a light bitterness on the finish that conflicts with the sweet maple and malts. The flavor is a little messy. There is a sweet maple up front that blends well with a sweet malt before the bitterness hits. When it does toll through, it's almost out of place. The mouth feel is decently carbonated and not too bad in terms of viscosity. The finish is lingeringly sweet with a hint of bitter. Decent, could be better. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2015 bottle. Pours dark brown. Taste is bourbon, roasty malt, some dried fruit and the maple syrup is actually detectable. Alcohol is warming. Bitterness is piney and fairly strong. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Black pour with an off white head. Big bourbon aroma with earthy hops and malt. Mouthfeeel is thinner than I would like but big bourbon, vanilla, toffee, and a little maple syrup flavor. Really good brew!

Pours a dark mahogany with a foamy tan head. Aroma is bourbon, wood, earthy hops, toffee. Flavor is wood, sweet toffee, and bourbon. I dont get much maple, but the maple does lend a dryness. Bitterness is very low. Body is smooth and full like a stout. Quite good.

750 ml. pours opaque with a creamy disc of foam. Nose is dark chocolate, whiskey, blackberry wine and brown sugar. Dark chocolate, molasses, blackberry syrup show up in the flavor. Finish has oak, whiskey, toffee and red wine. Medium-heavy body leans sweet and has a smooth medium carbonation. The whiskey, the barrel and the roasty acidity are able to sweep away the sweetness pretty well, but this is definitely a dessert sipper.

Yooooooo! This is goooooood! Bomber shared with Dad, Xmas day 2015. Dark poor, not black. Chestnut highlights show through. Thin head and decent lacing. Bourbon on the nose with pine. Man, theres a lot going on here. Cocoa, roast and a lot of hops. Sweet maple is prevalent, but not sickly. The sweetness coats the tongue, but isnt cloying. A nice, pine and citrus bite. Theres a lot that could have gone wrong with this complex array of flavors, but they are all in perfect balance. Good stuff.

Bottle. Pours black with a small beige head. Mostly citrusy aroma. Citrusy flavor with some chocolate malt as well. Medium bodied with a somewhat sweet and somewhat bitter finish. Well balanced and very good.
Bottle shared by a friend. Pours darkest brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of malt, maple, molasses and grassy hops. Malty flavor with maple and grassy hop accents before a sweet finish.

Bottle. Poured a deep, dark black with a medium foamy head. Aroma of chocolate, wood, maple, and bourbon. Flavor follows the nose and was very smooth and easy drinking. I agree with another rater that it was more on the stout side, than a black IPA. My friend actually said the same thing as well. Full body, sticky texture, average carbonation, smooth and easy finish. No alcohol bite from the barrel aging at all. It was a sipper for sure, but finished smooth after each sip.
Aroma is a mix of bourbon and pine, taste is all over the place, sweetness, bourbon, and some bitterness kick to it. This beer is confused... drinks more like a stout than a black ipa.
Whiskey and prune nose. Black, thin tan head. Cocoa, bourbon, and almond. Medium body, moderate carbonation.

Bottle, 12/22/2015. Pours dark brown, light tan head with ample creamy lacing. Aroma is rich maple syrup, caramel, vanilla bourbon, pine hops rising in the middle, some roast peaking through. Taste is sweet maple, fruity, pine and bitterness trying to balance. Thick body. Mostly sweet, maple notes, barrel dominated, the hops struggle to come through. Not the best combination IMO.

Bottled. Poured very dark brown with a ruby tint to it.. nice toasted beige head. The aroma picked up sweet maple, molasses, and a pinch of honey accented by bourbon and spicy hops.. more on the rich, malty, and bourbonny side than IPA.. quite nice. The flavor found mostly maple and bourbon sweetness at the core, with molasses and vanilla laced throughout.. peppery hops played well with roasty maple and bourbon on the edges and through the finish.. some oxidation crept in and got in the way. Heavier-bodied with enough carbonation to keep it moving.. overall a good feel, and a very tasty brew.

Bottle:
Pours almost black with a tall, thick, tan head.
Vanilla, bourbon, pine aroma.
Taste is sweet, maple syrup, vanilla, mild bourbon....
Creamy and soft at first, then slowly escalating bourbon warmth and richness.
Wonderful.

Location: 750 ml bottle from Hoboken Vine, 12/22/15


Aroma: The aroma is heavy on the bourbon, oak, and vanilla, didnt get much hop or maple syrup

Appearance: Pours a dark brown color with a creamy tan head and medium-heavy lace

Flavor: Flavor also comes through on the boozier and sweeter side of bourbon barrel beers

Palate: The body is fairly full, soft carbonation, a somewhat sticky feel, and a good bit of heat 

Overall Impression: 
Yeah, so first off theres nothing IPA about this beer, black or not.  I get that it spent some time in a barrel, but I dont even get old IPA hops here.  The alcohol and the barrel flavors in general dominated whatever lies underneath. Bit too hot right now as well. I would say this could use some time to mellow, but you cant mellow everything else while adding hops back...  

As I get closer to the end of the bottle and it warms to room temperature the maple comes out a bit and the heat fades a bit.  Its still lacking in hops and balance though, and the aroma is still overrun by the bourbon.

Tap. Served black with an ample khaki head. Aromas of oak and bourbon until the head dissipates considerably. Then, some fruity hops come to the fore along with maple. Tastes sweet, sticky on the lips, with a light bitterness creeping in on the back end. Some alcohol apparent after it has warmed. Maple last well into the finish. Medium+ bodied. Finishes extremely dry.

Bottle. It poured a dark brown color with an off-white head. The aroma was of roasted malts, maple syrup bourbon, vanilla oak and some earthiness. The taste was similar to the aroma with more roasted malts, maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla, oak and some bitterness. Awesome.

Dark beer with attractive mahogany hues when held against the light. Foamy beige head. Maple and bourbon barrel nose. This is a sweet beer with lots of maple, vanilla, oak, bourbon and over ripe fruit. The hops come out toward the finish with some pine and a lot of resin. This gets pretty boozy as it warms. This is pretty rich.

On tap at the brewery son!!! Smell is super gross. Taste is amazing! More charachters!!!! Maybe its time to switch to untapped. Im sort of done writing so much. 

The good thing about this is its a black ipa that is actually tastes like a stout. But its not... Its definately an ipa.

On tap at the Stoneyard with Erica and Chris. Black pour with small head and little lacing. Upfront Bourbon nose followed by pine. Mix of vanilla, chocolate, and semi sweet malts with a dominate Bourbon flavor. Has a layer of pine hop bitterness. A balance of flavors that I like. Some burn in the finish.

750 ml bottle shared with a friend. Dark brownish black with light tan head. Aromas of pine, roast, toasted nuts, a little soy. Tastes of pine, roast, maple syrup, some oaky bourbon. Medium body with a dry finish. Well hidden alcohol. Pretty tasty, nice balance.

750ml bottle. Pours a darkish brownish black with a thick, tan head. Nice lacing, decent head retention. Aroma of barrel, maple syrup, hop and dark malt notes. Flavor is maple syrup and bourbon with mild sweetness and slight bitterness. Thick, syrupy body with prickly carbonation. Finishes sweet and boozy. Interesting.

UPDATED: DEC 26, 2015 Aroma is maple, bourbon barrel, earthy hops, roasted malt, pine. Appearance is black, light brown head, thick. Taste is maple, bourbon, barrel, roasted malt, not really getting hops very much. Mouthfeel is medium body, medium carbonation, pretty standard. Overall, this is not as good as expected but I?m still enjoying it.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with beige head that fades quickly. Aroma is very complex. Caramel, maple syrup, coffee, chocolate, pine, grapefruit. Taste is incredibly balanced with moderate bitterness and sweetness. Flavors of maple syrup, caramel, toffee, pine, earthy notes, chocolate, vanilla. Hides high ABV incredibly well. Very tasty and definitely one of if not the best black IPAs I've had. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Berts
Dark brown/black color with a creamy bubbly off white head. Fruity spicy earthy hops with plenty of ethanol and barrel character. Light roasty sugary maltiness. Nice beer if not a little boozy.

Earthy maple aromas, bourbon, vanilla,caramel, earthy hops, coffee. Brown-black with a somewhat lasting off-white head. Mostly dry, some initial caramel sweetness, bourbon and coffee flavors, minimal maple. Full bodied.

Bottle. Pours ink black with creme colored head that lingers. Super sweet aroma over mild carbonation. Sugary maple flavor with black IPA finish. It's mostly the maple with some hop bite balance. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has an earthy pine note with dark grains as well as some maple and bourbon underlying. Flavor has sweet dark grains and bourbon with some maple and grass supporting.
Bottle - Pours black tan head - nose/taste of maple syrup, bourbon, coffee, caramel, grass, hop resin and burnt vanilla/chocolate- medium body
Bottle. Brown pour with tan head. Maple, sweet aromas, some herbal and earthy hop aromas. Light maple, herbal and earthy hop Flavors, sweet tones.

A beer like this doesnt come along every day. Pours black with creamy off white head. Beautiful aromas of maple syrup, dank hops, vanilla, bourbon. Think drunken pancakes. Smooth and seamless maple and piney hops flavours. Founders has managed to seamlessly blend common ingredients that shouldnt work. It does work though. A world class beer from a world class brewery.

Black with a tan head. Aroma of bourbon barrel, roasted malt, resin and syrup. Taste is roasty and woody and bitter and slightly sweet, with a decent helping of booze. Its actually a little subdued versus what I was expecting. The balance is nice though and everything clicks together quite well. Average carbonation, medium-full sticky body. It hasnt retained all that much of what Id call black IPA character, but no matter, its regardless some really good stuff.
750ml bottle pours a dark brown with a tan head. somewhat of a pine hop taste with a maple finish, not sure about this beer. too much flavors going on to really enjoy

bottle poured into a tulip..black with a medium tan head..aroma of bourbon,
maple syrup,resin,licorice..tastes of maple syrup,bourbon,vanilla,resin,oak..
interesting mix..well done.

This beer is damn near perfect. Starts with a dark, dark pour that has a khaki head, which leaves a nice lacing on the glass. The aroma is hoppy, chocolatey, maple-y, coconut-y, a bit of coffee and roasted malts. The taste is superb! Follows the nose with the addition of vanilla. The mouthfeel is relatively thick. Overall, this beer is fantastic.

Bottle at home. Pretty pitch black, though short of motor oil viscosity. Small espresso head. A lot happening in the nose: piney, resinous hops, roasted malt, chocolate, maple-bourbon definitely coming through. Pretty sweet beer, though the hops do a good job of tempering it. Kind of nuts how well this works.
Poured a darker btown with a beige head. Aroma was of pine and big vanilla and coconut barrel. Flavor similar, sweet, confectionary almost with some piney hops and big booze. Different.

I really didnt expect to like this one given my overall feeling on the Black IPA concept (abomination). +++ Sampled on draft at 3R6P this beer poured a black color with a small foamy dark tan head that left decent lacing. The aroma was sweet with pineapple, pine, chocolate, vanilla, wood and whiskey. The flavor was very sweet and tart yet bitter with notes of pineapple, pine, rum, whiskey, wood and toasty malts. Very long finish. Moderately full bodied and surprisingly smooth. Alcohol well contained. Excellent.

Bottle. Pour is dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma is lightly resinous and lightly Sweet with pine notes and marshmallow. Flavor is hoppy up front which gives way to a sweet Maple/ vanilla note. Finish is long and sweet with lingering hops. This is strange. I do like the maple notes but really does not work for me with the hops. Very small sample would be enough. Sadly Im looking at a whole bottle.
Bottle. Dark cola with tan head. Citrusy and piney hops, chocolate and roasted malt, oak, maple syrup and vanilla. Rich slick mouthfeel. Awesome.
Bottle shared thanks to Dan. Pours a dark brown black with a light tan head. Aromas of pine and maple, vanilla. Taste is sweet with a bitter kick in the end. Medium light body.

Draft. Poured dark brown color with an average frothy tan head that lasted and produced good lacing. Medium to heavy complex toasted sweet malt, complex hop and alcohol aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy dark bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. This is a solid beer.

Nice strong light brown head of fine bubbles. Very dense and creamy on top. Lots of bourbon, vanill and butterscotch in the aroma with some rich dark roasted malts, molasses and rubber. Color is a very dark brown. Interesting flavor. More burnt flavors than I expected. Salty terraki beef jerky, cinders, sweet malts, very mild bourbon overtones. Moderate alcohol presence and warming. Light sweetness permeates the entire brew. Not really noting any maple flavors though. Mild bitterness. Finishes smokey and roasty with some dry grains. A ok brew but the mix of flavors is not sitting great in the stomach.
Black pour. Big tan head. Little lacing. Hoppy aroma with wood and slight bourbon and maple. Taste is sweet malt, maple with piney hops.

Black brown pour. Nose of sugary maple syrup, pine, grapefruit hops, and light cocoa. Flavor is maple, light bourbon, vanilla, cola, cocoa, and a citrus/grapefruit bitter finish. Thinner than expected. Overall this worked really well. The sweet maple balanced the heavy bitterness of the hops.

UPDATED: DEC 12, 2015 Bottle to wine glass. Look: dark black, off white head, lasting. Aroma is mild hops, mild whiskey, pepper?. Bottle was refrigerated, but we removed early to let it warm up a little before pouring.   Taste: ash, syrup, some hops, but mellow. aftertaste is cola, wood, resin. feel: lively, smooth. A little sticky. Good beer. I have to say I am a little disappointed, as I was expecting a flavor profile closer to CBS. this is nowhere near that beer, but still quality and interesting.   Maybe a few years in the cellar will give it the complexity that it lacks.   It should also be noted that we sampled this immediately after an experience with a 20 year old Sam Adams Triple Bock.   Gasoline would seem to have a subdued taste after that behemoth.

Wow, the bourbon on the nose is crazy. Super-dark brown color. Taste is bourbon, roasty malt, some dried fruit and the maple syrup is actually detectable. Alcohol is warming, a little too obvious for my tastes, but not too bad. Bitterness is piney and fairly strong. The sweetness is not cloying at all thanks in part to the strong hops. Excellent, and definitely a sipper.

Sampled from a bottle, 
this ale poured a dark brown (almost black) into the glass and presented a two to three finger light tan colored cover that receded and left nice lacing on the glass, it had a good presentation, 

the nose had aromas of maple syrup, brown sugar and roasted malt out front with some coffee, citrus and spice hops, faint molasses, vanilla and faint dark fruit in the background, 

the flavors were maple syrup, roasted malt, bourbon, coffee, citrus hops and vanilla, 
the finish had hop bitterness with some alcohol bite that provided balance to the sweetness in the drink, 

this beer was towards the full side mouth feel wise, it was a little creamy and it layered on the tongue, there was soft to average carbonation, 

I thought the mix of roasted malt, hops, maple syrup and barrel aging was nice.

Dark mahogany pour with a dense beige head. Oily lacing. Aroma is vanilla, brown sugar, bourbon, light coffee and pine. Taste is maple syrup, bourbon, light coffee, and pine comes through in finish. Some alcohol warmth. A little on the sweet side with bitterness coming through in the end. Slick body. Good beer.

Bottle into wide wine glass. Nice fluffy tan head. Aroma of old IPA, faded hops, thin oaky barrel. Detect maple syrup not at all which is fine with me. Coats the tongue nicely, has a sort of dimmed hoppy strong ale flavor, but the barrel balances out the dwindled hops - always a mild note behind the scene. Coats the glass nicely with lace, head never completely dissipates. Not memorable, and yet very good at the same time.

Draught > Common Table. Interesting beer. Lots of different flavors at different times. Hoppy, dry, boozy, vanilla, and syrupy. Don't know how Founders figured all these would work together but they do. A better imagination than I have. Easy sipper to boot. I couldn't drink more than one of these b/c it's too sweet but one is fine.

A little boozy for my tastes, a touch too much barrel. Other than the whiskey theres some roast malt here and nut. Not a lot of citrus. Pours black with great head and lacing. Bitter finish. Tap at churchkey.

Tap. Deep opaque mahogany, medium tan head. Quite boozy in the aroma, some sweet maple and dark fruit notes, and later oak and bourbon vanilla come in. Flavor is a touch better in hiding the alcohol bite, bourbon shines, touch of the maple syrup sweetness and leafy bitterness. Medium to thicker body.

Pours a silky burnt umber color with a finger plus of thick khaki foam. Nose is roasted grain, dark cocoa, some sharpie marker, acetone, pine, citrus and sweet maple. Complex but there is that underlying abrasive chemical note thats distracting. Palate follows and there is some reallynice things happening here as the beer warms up. Silky sweet maple undertones mingle with grapefruit, wet grass, bitter pinecone and dark bakers cocoa. Some sips Im in heaven some Im thinking about pouring it out. Strange but fun. Almost too much happening here to wrap my tongue around.

On draft at Happy Gnome. Pretty hard to pull the trigger on a $11 10 oz pour. Come on Gnome, I love you but your prices are pretty outrageous! Thick, dark black pour with a slight head. Really lovely nose on this, some nice roast malt, big resinous pine hops and bourbon. Delicious taste. Yummy black IPA pine hops. Really cool toffee bourbon maple finish. Would love to find a bottle around town to age for a year to let the hop character mellow.

Bottle. Pours out pretty much black with a small off white head. Aroma is of syrup, dark chocolate, light citrus bitterness, oak, whiskey and light alcohol burn. Taste is complex, lots of sweet maple syrup, vanilla, oak, chocolate, mild toast, light tell of alcohol, some moderate citrus,/lightly piney bitterness with a touch of alcohol warmth. Really solid.

750 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a sudsy creamy khaki head that settles to a thin film and collar. Aroma has great bourbon maple malt chocolate and soft hops that bring subtle pine spruce tips to mind. Taste has a quick little bitterness that follows with maple bourbon vanilla and roasted malt slight chocolate. Palate is medium full very smooth silky and really enjoyable. Really digging this.

Picked up 2 bombers. Pours a dark brown that doesnt let light through with a frothy tan head that stays with the beer. Nose is pine, citrus, orange chocolate bar, vanilla, and bourbon. Flavors of vanilla, oak, syrup, pine. Mouthfeel is velvety smooth, very oily. Finish is boozy warm. This beer is hugely complex, very well done.

Pours a dark mahogany brown with fluffy tan head. Aromas of dark malts, touch of hops, and some woody bourbon notes. Smooth malty taste to start, then hops, and a bourbon finish. More barleywine than Black IPA, IMO.

Bottle. Black with a big mocha head. Bourbon, chocolate, huge oak barrel presence, balanced hops with citrus hints and pine, maple syrup finish that builds up in layers, roasted malts, warm boozy finish at times. Really balanced integration of all the elements that went into this one. Excellent. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle 22oz. Very stellar black ipa. Usually overwhelmed with malts, this strikes the best balance ive had of the style. Excellent beer

It pours black with light not getting through and a light brown head. It has aromas of citrus and floral with bourbon and roasted malts being the most prominent. It has a initial rush of chocolate flavor with roasted malts and a heavy dose of maple syrup with citrus and floral hops. The combination and layers of flavors is very complex and comes at different parts of the tasting. It has a moderate texture and in spite of the maple flavoring, it is not slick. It has a sweet and bitter finish with alcohol warming that is not hot.
December 5, 2015 - on tap at Happy Gnome. Dark pour with limited head. Maple sweetness and bourbon are strong in the aroma. Taste was nicely balanced with the maple, bourbon, wood and hops.

750 bottle. Black pour with small head and little lacing. Upfront Bourbon nose followed by pine. Mix of vanilla, chocolate, and semi sweet malts with a dominate Bourbon flavor. Has a layer of pine hop bitterness. A balance of flavors that I like. Some burn in the finish.

Admittedly I usually hate black IPAs. With that noted, this is not a bad beer. I really like how the maple sweetness and vanilla notes work with the malt backbone of this beer. The hops are mostly aromatic, though still hoppier than I would like.

Draft to taster. Looks good; a translucent dark brownish cola with foamy beige head. Smells good too; dark malt and piney and citrus zesty hops. Alongside notes of vanilla, oak, and maple syrup. Tastes like it smells with a medium full-bodied mouthfeel thats slightly hot, but pleasant nonetheless. Good stuff!

Draft at Churchkey. Dark clear maroon brown color, fluffy brown head. Aroma has whiskey, vanilla, big booze. Taste has lots of alcohol, some riast. The alcohol dilutes everythjng else. Too boozy for me.

Easy drinking black IPA at Church key on tap. Great bourban taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour on tap at HopCat, dark black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of dark cocoa, roast, chocolate, vanilla, some dark fruit, slight pine, oak, hints of bourbon into a bit of spice. Taste was a mix of nice sweet chocolate, maple, molasses into some oak, dark fruit, vanilla, roasted coffee comes through into a bit of pine, slight citrus peel, finishing slightly sweet, slightly boozy. Could use a bit of time actually, but the components are well balanced.

750ml bottle from Spirits Brick drank at the work cigar party. Poured a medium density dark black with a smaller foamy beige head. Ar/fl of maple, bourbon, vanilla, oak, dark toast, dark chocolate, burnt sugar and light citrus rind. Medium body, lightly syrupy, average carbonation with just a hint of heat and an average to slightly lingering aftertaste.

Pours a very dark brown to black with a decent mocha khaki head that leaves some spotty lace. Nose involves chocolate, whiskey, dank juicy citrus hops, light smoke notes, and cola. Pretty sweet (where the maple shines), somewhat bitter. Lighter side of medium bodied, fairly active, prickly and drying with hop oil, finishing long and warm with whiskey, smoke, and oak char. A damn fine beverage, perhaps surprisingly light on the palate considering the heft, but its Dark Penance as a base, not Imperial Stout or something like that, so it makes sense. Deadly drinkable with lots of good qualities in there. Another well-made Backstage brew.
Bottle. Color is deep brown with nice head. Aroma is sweet sugar hoos and caramel. Taste is oak, maple sugar and finish bitter hop. Almost as good as Jimmy from hill farm

750 ml. bottle. Pours a very dark brown with a nice tan head. Aroma of malt, maple, pine, and bourbon. Taste is roasted malt, maple, bourbon, pine, vanilla, and oak. Didnt think I would like this, but was wrong.
Tap at Grizzlys. Jet black pour with a small soapy head. Citrus, bourbon, and wood aroma. Maple syrup sweetness. Little bit of booze heat. Love it!
Tap at Grizzleys. Dark pour. Wiskey and grains aroma. Taste is more whiskey boozy than I like. Finishes kind of dry. Not bad.
Small sample. Very nice notes of roasted malts, caramel, whiskey and wood with a splash of hops. A solid blend with a medium body. Well done.

On tap at the brewery. Pours black with a dark brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has an earthy pine note with dark grains as well as some maple and bourbon underlying. Flavor has sweet dark grains and bourbon with some maple and grass supporting.

Pours a deep black, with a hint of ruby at the bottom when held up to the light. 

Hoppy aroma and a faint sweetness. 

Hop bite at the first sip which immediately fades into a thick syrupy-bourbon sweetness. Faint alcohol heat at the end. Holy shit this is a good beer.

Really balanced..the hops and the bourbon maple syrup barrels both come through and dont over power each other. delicious.

A mahogany pour leads to a black body with a fading, very tight khaki head with frothy crown creating an array of islands, webs, and dots of lace

A fog of complimentary characteristics with medium intensity and stealthy complexity... subtle tropical fruits round and augment highlighted whiskey character while a layer of mild maple fills any transitional gaps while also mingling with layers of fresh oak and coconut focused barrel as well as smooth dark malts to create a sweet base with solid depth... an array of subtle nuances are conjured... piña colada, grape juice, blueberry pancakes, damp tree bark, medium roast coffee and cream, powdered maple long-john, white chocolate, milk chocolate, key lime pie, pine needles and branches... 
A smooth medium-light body offers necessary building creaminess with light carbonation and mild spirit warmth... residuals continuing the trend of well integrated components offering transitioning nuance...as subtle as it is enjoyable

Capped 750ML consumed one day after KC release at 45-55º into 14.7 oz Zwiesel Cognac Snifter
From bottle in goblet. Medium tan head black body. Nose is nice, raisin, fruit,, floral, black licorice. Medium body, medium carbonation, light bitterness. Really well balanced, nice beer.
Aromas of fresh hops and maple with some caramel. Dark black body and light off white head. Flavors of roasty hops and maple with some malty carmel spice in the end. Smooth with a tad bit of heat.
Not always a fan of the black ipas but this one was delish. The maple bourbon flavor was pretty prominent.
Snifter. Aroma is hops, chocolate, and maple syrup, taste is sweet, but not nearly as sweet as other maple barrel aged beers, the hops balance this out much better! Heaven in a glass.

Bottle. Aroma is pine, vanilla, huge oak, maple, dark bread, light mint, and light coconut. Taste has huge oak as well with lots of vanilla. Dark malts, coconut, dark chocolate, light bitter coffee grounds. Light lingering bourbon with a touch of maple and mint. Medium to full body. Somewhat creamy mouthfeel. Really good. Might try to pick up a couple more.

Draft to taster at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a dark cola brown color with a small off beige head. The aroma and flavor have big roasted malts, maple syrup, bourbon, vanilla, oak, there is an earthy bitterness from the hops, all kinds of flavors coming from this, solid, I will update with more details later.

750ml bottle from BrookFalls - fresh. Whiskey. Caramel. Some citrus and maple syrup. Not as much of the "ipa" part in the flavor blend; the dark malts show mostly with the vanilla and the maple constantly peeking through. This likely should be aged as an impy stout, not drank fresh for the hop presence. Now to find another to cellar .... 15.8

Aroma: woody, bourbon, caramel, alcohol, 
Appearance: black with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, bourbon
Palate: full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish, 

Delicious

Aroma is pine, hops, barrel funk and a hint of maple syrup/sweetness. The flavor is pine needles, grapefruit, dark malts, mild whiskey/maple funk and a slightly sour/sweet/very warming alcohol finish.

Poured From a 75 cl bottle it is a dark brown color with an ecru head. The aroma is pineapple with some other fruits. The taste is is strong bourbon flavor with hints of vanilla and finishes rather bitterly.
From a 75 cl bottle shared at the OBX. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of tropical fruits. Flavors of bourbon, oak and vanilla. Bitter hop finish.

There are evident similarities to CBS and where I thought the sweetness overpowered CBS this much hoppier roastier beer works much better. This beer is sweet. Very very sweet. On a level where the malty sweetness and the almost artificial swetness from the maple syrup mix together. Its a little blurry tasting. Like theres a lot going on. It doesnt make it bad, becaus everything it tries to do, it does so well.
750 ml bottle. Dark pour. Creamy tan head. Maple syrup up front. Bourbon. Vanilla. Medium mouthfeel. Chocolate. Very good.

Pours dark brown color with tan head. Aromas of bourbon, maple syrup, pine, citrus, roasted malt, and oak. Bourbon and sweet maple syrup flavors with pine, vanilla, roasted malt, oak. Full body with moderate carbonation and a slick mouthfeel. Really nice.

The beer pours very dark with a good sized dense tab head. The aroma has herbal/piney hops, roasted malt, dark caramel, molasses, mild oak, sweetness and some bourbon. It has a medium/ full body with lots of fairly soft carbonation. The flavor starts with some roast, woody/piney/ herbal/citrus hops, raw oak, mild bourbon and traces of vanilla. The finish is pretty dry and shows a touch of maple. As it warms there is more vanilla, coconut, maple and bourbon barrel notes.  Somehow it masked the high alcohol very well.  Really nice

Bottle: The aroma moderate chocolate, lighter bourbon,coconut, maple syrup, vanilla, a hint of oak, and maybe some pine. It pours a dark brown with some faint orange highlights. It has a large beige head that settles to a thick soapy film. There is some spotty lacing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate chocolate with a touch of caramel. There is some faint roast in the back ground. The finish has bourbon, lighter maple syrup, coconut, vanilla, faint pine, and a touch of oak. Its medium bodied with mild carbonation. Im really digging this. This is probably the second best Backstage Series after CBS.
